author: Christopher Alessi
title: Prices Pause After Big Drop on OPEC Talks
text:
LONDON—Oil prices edged up Wednesday, while the U.S. dollar weakened, as the market appeared to steady after days of losses.
Brent crude, the global oil benchmark, was up 0.48% at $75.85 a barrel on London’s Intercontinental Exchange. On the New York Mercantile Exchange, West Texas Intermediate futures were up 0.16% at $66.84 a barrel.
